I will start with saying that this won't feel like an 8/10 anime for everyone. It's depressing, dark, annoying at times. The plot goes over-the-top in last two episodes and the ending is definitely off-putting. You will hate many of the characters, especially the protagonist, who starts as a misguided teen, but ends up as a completely despicable person, selfish, uncaring and seeing woman as barely anything more than just sexual objects.
What I disagree with, in reference to many other reviews, are the claims that this series is poorly written, cheap and all characters are negative/unlikeable. The show uses a bit of similar themes asElfen Lied, exploring the worst parts of human nature, this time in relation to sex, romance and high school environment. It shows negative consequences of peer pressure, bullying and, above anything else, not being able to handle emotions and understand each other in early relationships (here between inexperienced teens). 


While the protagonist simply disregards other people's feeling and act only according to his own whims, making him one of the most unlikeable leads out there, I find most of the female characters much more ambivalent and tragic. They take misguided decisions and often act against their own convictions, but mostly because they don't know how to handle their emotions and, unlike the protagonist, they actually feel guilty about it. Both Sekai and Kotonoha are above all victims, even if the former is definitely not without guilt herself. While one can say they act stupidly when it goes to their relations with the protagonist, they're basically kids and it's not that unbelievable at any point.


I also see this anime as a sort of critique of harem fiction. It shows how protagonists engagement with multiple women destroys everyone involved, either psychologically or literally kills them. That's also how it often ends in real life, as behaviours portrayed here aren't completely taken out of nowhere. I find it cathartic after seeing so many kitsch plots where the main character can bang anything that moves without any consequences. Here we're shown how the weakness of character, disregard for other's feelings and inability to create real relationship have deep repercussions.


Like I've said, it's easy to question giving this anime a positive rating. It goes over the top at the end and writers make some questionable decisions. But it also succeeds in what it tries to achieve - create a disturbing, dark story that will leave you scarred if you're not prepared for what's coming. It doesn't show any hope for the characters, doesn't force any kind of happy ending. But that also makes it honest in a way. Unlike some, I didn't find it cheap or exploitative, apart from a few isolated moments. I feel like everything I saw, at least up to a certain point, could happen for real, and while it might be horrible, there is some truth in it, one that is not that often shown in anime (and probably wasn't shown in any other series in this high quality). For that, I give it a full rating and recommendation, if you can stomach the pain of watching rather believable and in some cases likeable characters destroy themselves in a horrible fashion.


As I side note of sorts, I also think it worked really good as an advertisement for the visual novel - it shows the worst possible outcome and made me curious about what other paths the original game might offer. Navigating the maze of School Days HQ and seeing happy endings for Kotonoha and Sekai after experiencing the emotional despair of the anime is just that much more rewarding.

First off, I have heard some people praise this show for being an accurate and dark take on school life. I only half agree with that since some of the decisions in this show seem stupid or just plain ridiculous and most of the characters in this show are too one-dimensional or too unrealistic. Now onto the review.
Ok first off, the Story (4):
This story is your typical harem story but with many dark twists to it. It begins with your typical love triangle between the main character, Makoto (a HUGE douche) and two other girls, Kotonoha and Sekai. Sekai gets Makoto and Kotonoha together butquickly develops feelings for him. As the story progresses, it gets more unlikely or unrealistic since people are (as I have said before) making stupid or ridiculous decisions. When Sekai said "i'll give you practice." I was thinking '...wow...' First time I have ever heard of an offer like that. The story just keeps spiraling downwards and downwards. It was quite dull most of the time until one of those dodgy decisions pops up, then it returns to being dull again. I have to give it some points for SOME realism and its dark feeling but not much. So as I have said, I didn't particularly like the story which is one of the main reasons I came into this, other reason including the ending. I have to say, the ending was quite satisfying.


Art (5):

The art was pretty meh, nothing I haven't seen before. The animation didn't really have any parts to shine in. Not much else to say here.


Sound (5):

Most of the music including the opening and ending themes were quite forgettable. They did fit the anime well but they were nothing impressive. The only piece I quite liked was the dark, piano piece that played at the end of some of the episodes when something dark or bad was happening. This was one of the few things that compelled me to watch the next episode.


Character (2):

First of all, Makoto. One of the most universally hated characters in the history of anime simply because he is a huge douche to not only his girlfriend but many other girls as well. You have to give him credit though, I have no idea how he managed to get with so many different girls. I'm not sure what any of them found appealing in him but none the less, he is somehow appealing to them. I actually hated Kotonoha more than Makoto (only by a bit) because she did absolutely nothing after she found out certain bad things about Makoto. Other than that, she was quite meh until the ending. Sekai just annoyed me. Not entirely sure what parts of her character did. Any other characters that I thought had some decency just flushed that decency down the toilet. This is probably the weakest of the series.


Enjoyment (4):

There was some parts of the series that I did enjoy such as laughing at some of the situations some of the characters were in and the ending. But most of the time, this was overshadowed at my annoyance at how stupid some of the characters can be and (I cannot stress this enough) some of the decisions the characters made. There was a certain point where I just got sick of the repetitiveness of the decisions that the only reason I kept watching was for the ending. The only things I was remotely interested in was the initial love triangle and the ending (I have mentioned the ending a lot...). I eventually just cracked up out how insane and stupid some of the characters turned out to be. So it was relatively enjoyable at first but that died as the series progressed.


Overall (4):

In conclusion, the bad parts of the series outweigh many of the enjoyable/average parts that I found in this series.To sum it all up, I enjoyed the first part of the series because it was the most realistic and the ending because it was the most satisfying part of the anime. I didn't enjoy the repetitiveness of the stupid decisions and the unrealistic turn it had taken when it became a love square, pentagon or hexagon. None of this was helped by the mediocre sound and art. There is one thing I can take from this anime which is the most obvious point ever, don't cheat on your partner. Although, I highly doubt that if you do, it could lead to this. So yeah, I didn't really like School Days.

-This is my first review so please bear with me-
School Days is an anime which is based on a visual novel by 0verflow and is infamous for it's tragic endings. When I watched the ending of the anime, and I'm guessing a lot of people also did this, I laughed. Not a amused laugh, more like a crazy, evil laugh. That is how messed up the ending was.
Anyway....on with the review.
The story is about a trio of friends, Makoto, Sekai and Kotonoha. Makoto appears to be a normal high school boy. He has a crush on the girl he rides the train to school withand one day decides to take a picture of her, believing in the "Cellphone Charm", which states that if you take a picture of someone you like and nobody finds out, then you will be together with that person. Makoto's new seat mate, Sekai, see the picture and decides to help Makoto. She introduces him to Kotonoha, and continues to support him, but soon she starts to develop feelings towards Makoto as well.


One of this anime's biggest flaws is it's characters, and more specifically, Makoto. He is like poison in that he hurts everyone who gets involved with him and he, most of the time, doesn't even care. He is apparently popular with the females and I don't see a reason why. He's worthless, uncaring, perverted and other things. To quote some guy who commented on some site, "Makoto just wants more sex." The two female leads are the only ones who make this anime worth watching.


The ending was satisfying. In this anime, there is divine retribution. "You reap what you sow". Throughout the series, you can see whats coming and it will eventually come. It is a disturbing ending, and does not seem to be the ending of an anime with the title "School Days". The last part, however, creeped me out a bit.


In the end, everyone gets what they deserve. It's KARMA. This anime really shows how relationships can mess up your mental state and that the heart is really fragile. School Days hides under the guise of innocence and eventually shows it's true nature. It is a very interesting anime in that I've never seen an anime like this, but be prepared when you watch it.

Ohaiyou Gozaimasu! It's such a sunny day, perfect for an outing with your family and friends, perhaps have a decent picnic at the nearby park, and of course, row a little NICE BOAT on the lake while enjoying the radiance from the sun. 
Lol. Anime is fucking serious business, you should know that, and not something for you to sit back and relax about. A lot of anime should really be treated with due solemn, and that, of course, includes THIS - the bloodiest, sexiest, most so-horrible-it's-awesome harem series. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome School Days.
STORY:
Here's the recipe to make School Days: You start off withthe simple life of a perverted male high schooler. You add in a sexy bitch, with big boobs and an innocent mind and such, who became the official girlfriend of the high schooler. You add in a love rival, who pretends to be the love mentor of the high schooler, but instead enjoys sucking his d*** in the dark. Sprinkle some more bitches on top, throw in a complicated love-hate plot, wrapped with a bloody ending, let it simmer for thirteen episodes and you get School Days.


Of course, the gourmets have diverse opinions about the cuisine they tasted. For me, it's fresh, juicy and delicious. Fresh, because it has an original taste. Juicy, because the fanservice is too much to bear. And delicious... do I need to talk any more about that?


Put into simpler words, School Days is a highly satisfying series for me. Not only because of the unexpected ending which granted a 'happy' conclusion for our protagonist(s) (which I enjoyed a lot), but also because the pacing is excellent. I'm not being sarcastic here. Indeed, the flow of the plot is good and you can literally feel yourself immersed in the harem world of our protagonists. Or should I say, antagonists?


ART:

Now here's where School Days suffered a lot. The character designs were actually good, but if you put them into animation, oops. Other than the infamous pool episode, the (sex) scenes and the ending, I could not see good effort put into the drawing by our beloved animators. The characters seemed... off at a lot of times. 


SOUND:

Excellent. The soundtrack blended with the mood of the show well, turning from a few whimsical melodies in the earlier episodes, to melancholic, sorrow tunes in the middle episodes; and in the end, the music became so sad that you will weep just by hearing the soundtrack alone. For the vocal songs part, we have a few memorable inserts, particularly "Kioku no Umi" (which I also enjoyed a lot), "Namida no Riyuu" (used in the turning point of the series - the raining scene), and of course "Kanashimino Mukou e" used in the final ending. The OP also deserved a special mention, although I did not enjoy it as much as the other songs.


CHARACTER:

Since School Days is a deconstruction of the harem-high school genre, rather than saying that the characters received any form of development throughout the show, I would suggest that the characters received a lot of "anti-development" (yes, it's a new word I invented). Indeed, you can see Makoto turning from just a normal high schooler to a pervert who does nothing but having sex all day. Kotonoha turned from an innocent young woman to a love-craze. Sekai... Ughh. She was as bad as she was throughout the whole show. 


What I was particularly impressed about School Days is that it managed to give everyone a fair share of screentime. We see action from the main characters as well as the minor characters. The latter, especially, a few will get stuck in your head after you watched the show. For me, it's definitely Setsuna.


OVERALL:

School Days is an anime with a highly exciting setting and interesting development of the plot with a final twist that makes it unforgettable. In short, it's a good anime that I would recommend to my pals to watch, except for those whose hearts are weak of course.

I particularly enjoyed this anime although many others say that the ending is pretty messed up. Honestly, I think the ending is what makes it most exciting.
The story is rather interesting, about cheating and how a simple affair can easily change someone's life completely. I'm sure everyone knows that the ending is a bit different from the rest of the series, but that is not a bad thing, not at all. If it hadan't ended the way it did, I would probably say right now that School Days was about a boy who liked to mess around with all the girls in his school, breakingtheir hearts. Boring. I'm honestly thankful for the gore ending that changed the dull atmosphere right away.


The characters are ok. They carry a large variety of feelings and they are very very expressive. Each character is different in its own way so I can say that the anime includes all the types of classic anime characters.


I rated School Days 9/10 because there were a few less interesting episodes, so I didn't actually get bored. I find it amazing to watch an anime about the every day life of some school students and don't get bored.

School Days is one of the most controversial anime of all time. Some hate it, and some love it. What's my opinion on this work? Well let's take a look at School Days.
Story-9
The story of School Days is extremely interesting. Unlike most anime, it goes over problems that most wouldn't even dare to touch. But this is why many hate it. Unlike most harem anime, it does not focus on the happy parts of a relationship. School Days's uniqueness is what turns people away. This anime is great. Dont let people tell you otherwise because it is out right great.
The first thing you need to understand about this anime is that it is not a show, it is an experience. And as an experience it is best watched in one sitting. As you are watching School days you may find that the story is dragging on, but the last episode is what makes this show.
PLOT: It is going to be very hard to convey the plot to you without giving spoilers, but I will try my best.
First off this is NOT a love story, though it may appear likeone, it is much more beautiful than that. It is the story that shows to us the true hidden nature, that we all will deny, of the male and female spirit. Guys being horny bastards why doesn't give shit about girls emotions, and girls being dormant psycho paths.


Makoto, our main character, who I will refer to as Unlucky Lucky Bastard, or ULB for short. The story starts off with ULB starting off a new school year and riding on the same train as another main character Kotonoha, who I will be calling Psycho #1. ULB has a crush on Psycho #1 so his friend Sekai, or Psycho-slut, sets them up on a date. After that it terrible turn in fate ULB gets busy quickly unleashing the psychotic powers hidden within each of these girls by breaking their hearts.


Honestly its really hard to explain this plot seriously because its just a typical heartbreak/love story, until episode 12 that is. You wont like this anime if you don't like love stories. I felt that it did drag on near the middle but I encourage you to power through because it is worth it in the end. 


CHARACTERS: 

Unlucky Lucky Bastard is probably one of the most hated characters in anime history. I can understand why. He is a complete bastard who breaks every girls heart just to get laid 1 or 4 times a day but honestly guys he is just a typical horny high schooler. Girls can hate him because they don't want to think that normal guys would be like him in that situation, but guys hate him because he succeeded where guys have tried and failed. Honestly, at his age, most guys were very much like him.


He is just a typical horny teenager that spends the shoe thinking with the wrong head and so ends up doing things you as the viewer won't like.


Psycho #1 is an extremely attractive yet shy girl who most people sympathize with but who no one should. Now you may be wondering why there is a Psycho #1 but not a #2, #3, and so on, and the answer is simple, she is all of those numbers. You see one number wasn't enough to capture how psychotic she is. 


She starts off this show as a psycho path. Don't believe me? Name one sane person who serves hot lemonade. But don't worry, she will become much more insane over the course of the show, going so far as to physically transform by episode 11, giving up her eye color to sport pure black empty eyes.


Most people will say that ULB is the villian of the show but I think that Psych #1 is the main villian. Sure she is the product of ULB's creation, but for her to get so infatuated after a single date, I see her as a time bomb with her going crazy at some point or another.


Psycho-slut is the third main character. She is ULB's friend and is a very confident and out going person. Aside from her insanity she is a very likably character. She too, like Psycho #1, will grow gradually more insane over the course of the show. She too will be an antagonist of this show because she instegates all that is to happens in this show. She is more sympathetic because she is a half breed, half psycho half slut. Being such a half breed age doesn't posses the full power of the psychopath nor the free range of a slut.


She is an enjoyable character who has her ups and down moments but, like most characters in this show, if the words slut, psycho, or bastard aren't being used to explain her, she is just a normal teenager.


CONCLUSION: This show is great. The ending is the only reason you should watch this show and it will either be so shocking that you won't like it, or so shocking that you will love it. The majority of the anime is spent with a lot of the same thing happening over and over a few times in different episodes, so it does get repetitive. But there are some entertaining scenes to hold you ever untill thevend, like when a girl tells ULB "I will let you cheat on my best friend with me, if you promise never to cheat on her." #logic.


I recommend this anime because of how shocking the ending is. You wont be thinking about anything else for a long time after seeing it, so whether you liked it or not, the show did its job. And again watch it in one sitting or don't watch it at all.

School Days is not your typical anime series, it's a diversion to the past few shounen series I'm hooked to. I knew of the series when some of my roommates started watching it, and me being eternally curious, began watching it too.
Simply put, the anime is basically a part of reality for us teenagers, most of us are controlled by our hormones. Take Itou Makoto, the male protagonist of the series, as an example. He's the typical teenager guy that we see everyday at school: doesn't care about the world, listens to music, and secretly peeks at some girls in a perverted way.
He fell inlove with a girl he met on the train while heading to school. It was a normal love at first sight, and given the girl's beauty, he took a pic with his phone, which is a known " charm" to students.


But, the series has a darker, or should I say, more perverted meaning than the usual boy-meets-girl in an anime series.


Makoto, Sekai, and Kotonoha had a boy-bridge-girl relationship which got more and more complicated as the series continued. The plot was twisted enough to be as real as it gets.


The characters, especially Makoto and his girlS [yes, I capitalized the 'S' on purpose], have their own unique personalities and maybe, just maybe, you may relate to them, especially if you have experienced teen love.


But, the part I love the most is the ending of the series, because it was really shocking, and gave me creeps for the time being. Well, it ended Makoto's infinite loop of girls and at the same time, Sekai's paranoia.


The art and animation were all good, and there is even "fanservice" throughout the series [the close-up on the girl parts, especially on Kotonoha]. 


I'd recommend this to a person who is in a good mood, since I saw my friend [who just had a recent heartbreak] broke down while watching the series. There is something in School Days that stings to the reality of life that more or less, you'll relate.

A truly unique anime. You have not watched an anime like because it is truly special. It is so emotionally pushing, you probably won't feel as much emotion from any other anime. Feelings of depression, jealousy, sympathy, it is in truth a sad anime, not a bitter sweet one. 
To begin, this anime is NOT for beginning anime fans. Go watch some romance, tragedy, and lots of other anime first. The reason is because you have to know that pain and negative emotions exists in anime, it is not all fun and games. And you have to appreciate having these sort of feelings.
If you havenot seen this anime, go see it right now, and here is going to be massive spoilers from here on out so go watch it now! Go watch this unforgettable anime NOW.


The story is tragedy, a fall of the main character due to his flaws. In the entire course of the anime, we see how he ends up hurting others because of his flaws. We have a main character who is lustful and indecisive. The ending is that of a Shakespearean tragedy, everyone ends up broken. To those who say it has a "bad ending", just because sad things happen at the end does not mean it is not good. The ending wraps things up nicely and is not left open ended. That means it has a FITTING ending. 


The art is great. The reason is that they accomplish their means. Nothing stands out though, but that is not the highlight of this anime.


The voice actors were well chosen. The music was alright. The ending songs were ok. 


Now the characters are what to watch this anime for. To those who say "The main character is despicable", I completely agree. Who did not cheer when Makoto was stabbed to death. To those who say "The main character is very unrelatable", I ask, why? Many anime fans enjoy harems yet VERY FEW have harems in real life. How are they any more relatable than a guy who does not have the courage to ask a girl who he likes, and takes a girl out on the first date to an arcade? Who WOULDN'T get too much ego when there are girls fighting for him. Who WOULDN'T forget to pay attention to the feeling of girls when hes getting as much as he wants. Makoto is probably more relatable than any other popular/cute/strong main characters in any other harems. And the reason why so many people hate him might be because he reminds us all how stupid and lustful real guys can be. 

Analysis of characters-

 Makoto-  Immature boy at beginning, who is shy and somewhat considerate and is not straight forward. We see this when he helps Setsuna gain her courage. He is not smart nor very perceptive, as seen  by not realizing his middle school classmate had a crush on him. He is at first grateful for having Katonoha as a girlfriend, but soon wants to go further in their relationship. When a girl wants him, he has no motive to say no. Because of his premature mind, he does not realize how much he is hurting the girls. How could he? Whenever he was with a girl, that girl was happy to be with him at that moment. In his eyes everything was okay and all the girls were happy. Exactly what immature boys/men would do, but haters won’t admit it.

Sekai- A clinically depressed girl (Setsuna revealed this) who acts quickly and has a different code of morals.  Due to this, she is of the so called destructive type. This is seen when she  steals a kiss at the first episode, yells at Makoto at the pool, and first degree murder. Even though she set up Makoto and Katonoha.   I am no psychiatrist but I do know that sufferers love company, and that she really does want to be happy.  She breaks free of the tropes that often define and make a cliché heroine, especially in anime.

Katonoha- A faithful beautiful girl without any self-esteem.   She sees Makoto as her beacon of light for liking her. Quite an original character as a yandere and a silient sufferer.  It was shown that she was constantly bullied before and during the anime, and when she does get bullied, she cries and runs away. Or take the scene from my memory when Katonoha visits Makoto because he had ignored her for a long time. Upon opening the door, she asks if he is with anyone. He blatantly lies no, and makes an excuse that he was sick. Katonoha looks down and sees a pair of women's shoes inside the house, and a look of grief spreads to her face realizing his lie, yet does not accuse of lying and walks away. She is the most well thought out “silient sufferer” I have ever seen in anime.

The girls in this anime are complex and it is HEART BREAKING to see them mentally break down. Yes, some of them didn't make the best decision.  We are all human and I bet we all had those stupid teenage moments the characters are too. If you sympathize and try to understand them, you will have an emotionally painful experience. 

This also has one of the most famous scenes of anime, and I am not talking of Nice Boat, but when Katonoha cuts Sekai open. Most people just say, wow, that is disgusting and disturbing, but they missed out the most BRILLIANT line of anime of all time. Upon looking inside her, she says “Just as I thought it was a lie after all. There’s nobody inside”. Oh Katonoha, you master of figurative language…

I think the story was magnificent and the characters took me on the biggest emotional rollercoaster anime has ever had. 10/10

If you find beauty in all sorts of emotions, I think you will appreciate it as well.

(Deep breath)  I watched this, on account on one guy at school telling me to watch this after showing me the ending.  Of course, I'm sure many people would've done the same thing, which is, wanting to know what events occurred to make such a train wreck happen.  Now, I wish to punch that guy in the face for wasting my time!  But enough of that, onto the review.
Story: The story of "School days" revolves around our main "protagonist" Makoto.  In love with a girl named Kotonoha, he wants nothing more then to begin dating her, even going to theextent of using a picture of her as a charm as his cellphone wallpaper.  It isn't until a girl by the name of Sekai comes into the picture and decides to help him, which in the end, creates a love triangle.  


Characters: Pff...again, where do I begin?  Makoto, as the main protagonist, all he wants is love.  As the main premise for the story, he begins falling for Kotonoha, then switches to another girl, which, is normal for guys his age as crushes do come on and off.  However, what makes this guy really special, is that he is in fact, a complete ass.  Without breaking off a relationship, this guy cheats over, and over, and over, and over, and over, and etc.  You get my point.  This guy really has no personality whatsoever.  In fact, he shows nothing in terms of personality other then being a complete player.  Next, Kotonoha, or should I say, the fanservice in this anime.  A quiet and shy girl, she becomes romantically interested in Makoto and begins stepping out of her shy bubble and tries to be braver.  In the end, well, she's a yandere.  Finally, we have Sekai, the over spunky girl of the series.  Though personally, I like her as she has a smidge more personality then the rest of the girls, she's not really any different as her thoughts turn to murder as well, oh boy.  Then we have the other 5-6 girls and one other guy which play an extremely minimal role to that point that I will not mention them any further. 


Art and sound: The soundtrack is nothing too good as no matter how many times you listen to it, you really won't catch it in your head.  It's really generic and not too noteworthy.  The art on the other hand, is rather good.  The animation is very fluid and concise, and the characters themselves have really well done designs.  Probably my most favorite part of this show.


Personal Enjoyment: WARNING, some ranting may occur.  School days, is bad.  It's horrible and a disaster beyond belief.  Personally, I want the 4.5 hours I spent watching this back.  I really can't say anything good about this other then the art.  While yes, there were "good" points in the story, it really went downhill really fast.  First of all, Makoto himself.  There were many a time in this anime where the romance problems could've been solved rather easily.  First of all, break up with your current girlfriend!  IF that happened, this anime would've not had to end as it should've as its ending is very well known.  Second, I doubt anyone has this sort of problem at school, so it should be renamed to "Life of a high school player" or something.  And finally, idiotic choices.  Of course, if common sense was put into this anime, then it wouldn't be so debated as it really is.  However, I can't help but note that there are many idiotic choices made by the characters themselves that puts them to blame at how this turned out.  I-I-I can't say anymore.  Just a warning, watch at your own risk and try not to punch your computer screen in anger.  If you have a different opinion, I'd be glad to hear it.  Good day.  =w=

School Days starts off like a typical romance anime. Makoto, a seemingly normal guy, meets Kotonoha, and falls in love. After a few episodes I thought I might enjoy School Day. It wasn't anything special, but it wasn't horrible either. It's after the first few episodes that this anime begins to spiral downwards. 
The story itself wasn't the worst I have seen and it can keep you interested for a few episodes. That being said, by the end, the story failed to keep me interested. I only suffered through the later episodes to see the ending. 
The art was honestly pretty well done. It wasone of the better parts of School Days. Not too much to be said in this regard.


The sound wasn't too bad either. Not a whole lot to say about it either.


The characters are probably the reason I disliked this show so much. Makoto is a downright disgusting character, with no respect for anyone around him. The only motivation he has is to sleep with any girl he can. Kotohona is probably the only character I had any sympathy for and even then by the end of the show I found myself disliking her as well. The rest of the characters are awful as well. They have little regard for their "friends" and pretty much every supporting character only cares about themselves.


I really can't say I enjoyed this anime. Every episode made me hate the characters more than I had before. All I can say I enjoyed about the show was the ending. I had to struggle to hold back a smile, because I was so glad when it happened. It was the only thing that could somewhat justify my time spent with School Days. 


Honestly I'd say watch the show just for the ending. I would never watch School Days again for any reason somehow made it worth watching for me.
